alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 4:57AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rock Island, northwestern Henry and southeastern Scott Counties through 530 AM CDT... At 457 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Andalusia, or near Rock Island, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Milan around 505 AM CDT. Rock Island around 510 AM CDT. Moline around 515 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include East Moline, Silvis, Coal Valley, Colona, Hampton, Port Byron, Rapids City, Cleveland and Osborn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 12. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 280 between mile markers 11 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
